entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as someone who believed Snape was sorry James was dead. This shows that Dumbledore had a certain level of trust in Snape.

entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is mentioned as someone who hated James and called Harry's mother 'Mudblood'. He also joined forces with the Death Eaters after being alerted by Filius.

entities.name: james
entities.description: James is mentioned as someone who was dead and hated by Snape.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as someone whose mother was called 'Mudblood' by Snape. He also knew that Snape didn't think his mother was worth a damn.

entities.name: mcgonagall
entities.description: McGonagall is mentioned as someone who sent Filius to fetch Snape and alerted him to what was going on. She also felt guilty for this action.

entities.name: lupin
entities.description: Lupin is mentioned as someone who was incredulous about Dumbledore's belief in Snape and tried to defend McGonagall from blame.

entities.name: filius
entities.description: Filius is mentioned as someone who told Snape that the Death Eaters were coming.

entities.name: death eaters
entities.description: The Death Eaters are mentioned as a group of people who joined forces with Snape.

relationships.description: McGonagall alerted Snape to what was going on, which led him to join forces with the Death Eaters.
Filius told Snape that the Death Eaters were coming.
McGonagall's actions led to the involvement of the Death Eaters.
